data.title: Compound keyboard shortcuts should be delimited by commas

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #16560

Would help improve readability. This goes for watermark, docs, and command palette. For example:
1. `Ctrl+K Ctrl+M` -> `Ctrl+K, Ctrl+M`
2. `Ctrl+K M` -> `Ctrl+K, M`

Also note that this is scheme is consistent with almost every other editor out there. We also seem to do this for some commands, but not others. E.g. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/20948451/127db962-bbc9-11e6-9e75-185c5647f716.png)

<hr>

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (7499a9f3c565f4fbe5205e30c8664e5a5a11ae94, 2016-12-06T16:16:15.865Z)

data.title: "Open Folder" command displays as "unbound" in watermark
data.body:
Testing #16560

Doesn't appear that there's actually a keyboard shortcut? Also notice that the text is misaligned, so worth verifying that this wouldn't happen for other cases

Steps to reproduce:
1. launch vscode from terminal using `code-insiders -n`
2. close empty file that comes up to view watermark

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/20946712/b9feb29e-bbc0-11e6-8ce6-dc75100fbc28.png)

<hr>

- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14965

data.title: C/C++ class and macro highlighting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Debian 8.6 Jessie
In C/C++ highlighting assigns classes various different CSS tokens. It would give a much better overview of the code if classes was highlighted correctly.
Example:
````
class MyClass { };

MyClass mc = new MyClass();
```` 
the MyClass words get inconsistently highlighted.
Macros, when used like this, have inconsistent highlighting: 
```
#define DLLEXPORT __attribute__((visibility("default")))
class DLLEXPORT MyClass { };
```
I believe these issues are connected.

data.title: In-product release notes not displayed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Help > Release Notes
Goes out to wiki with fwlink 724002.

This is a regression from 1.7.2. The v1_8.md release notes file is now published on code.visualstudio.com/raw. If you update a 1.7.2 install package.json version to 1.8.0, Help > Release Notes works and displays v1_8.md in-product.

data.title: Unescape Markdown Escapes inside of a link
data.body:
Fixes #14968

**Bug**
Due to a bug in marked (https://github.com/chjj/marked/issues/829), markdown escapes inside of links are currently not rendered properly. As shown in #14968, this can also can effect regular text that contains characters that are escaped when we convert the text to markdown text.

**Fix**
For links, remove markdown escapes before rendering them.

data.title: Debug console cleared when a launch config starts
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15305

When I debug two processes, they share a debug console, which is ok. But when a new config starts, the console is cleared.

This is the behavior when there's just one process running, but since the console is shared, I think it shouldn't be cleared if a process is already running.

data.title: Debug widget dropdown is changed unnecessarily when continuing/stepping
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15305

Start debugging config A, then config B.

If B is paused, and I 'continue', then the dropdown is changed to A, whether or not A is paused. If A is paused and I continue, then it stays on A, whether or not B is paused.

I think this depends on which was started first.

Also if I'm stepping through B, then the toggle always switches to A for a fraction of a second before B pauses again. 

The gif doesn't capture it very well but you get the idea.
![dec-06-2016 14-34-17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/20946793/1d07ab20-bbc1-11e6-9dcb-91c21c76e30a.gif)

data.title: More specific Configure Excludes message
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (c425cd159bd389844e9400be801675f54f2443c7, 2016-12-06T16:53:46.634Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Testing #16534

The current message seems to general: "For better performance exclude folders with many files."

1. "better performance" is to weak because the typescript server basically shutdown and won't provide any of the advanced features.
2. "folders with many files" is vague, it should mention JavaScript/TypeScript files that the user does not work on (like packages/libraries).
3. It could also mention that this happens in the js-/tsconfig.json, that would set the right expectation for the 'Configure Excludes' button and also inform the user how this can be done manually.

Needs more thought: "Too many JavaScript/TypeScript files: To enable advanced editor features in JavaScript/TypeScript files exclude large folders with source files you do not work on."

/cc @gregvanl

data.title: Show which launch config is running when there's only one
data.body:
Test https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15305

If I have multiple launch configs running, I can see their names, but when there's just one, I can't see its name anywhere. Just a suggestion.

Maybe it could just be grayed out or strikethrough'd in the debug config picker.

data.title: Debug dropdown is not keyboard accessible
data.body:
#16494

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (c425cd159bd389844e9400be801675f54f2443c7, 2016-12-06T17:07:24.668Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-28-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.1.0|
|theme-glacier|Tyriar|0.0.10|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.7.1|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.0.0|
|Theme-Wombat|gerane|0.0.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-vscode|0.0.10|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.2.1|
|dark-plus-material|vangware|0.1.4|

---

When tabbing through the debug viewlet there are a few issues:

- The dropdown and button only take a single tab index
- Interacting with it via enter does nothing
- The focus for this single element is not visible

As part of this I recommend making `.start-debug` a styled `button`.

data.title: No feedback when waiting for program launch while another is running

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15305

Say I have an 'attach' launch config with the wrong port.

If I'm not debugging anything, and launch that config, I get a progress indicator in the debug viewlet, and the debug widget pops up, so I know it's working.

If I start another launch config first, then start my bad attach config, there's no indicator at all, but 10s later, a message pops up saying that it failed.

Maybe the entry should show up in the debug widget when I start the launch, rather than when it successfully attaches.

Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15305

If I hover the cursor over the dropdown handle in the debug config picker, I get a tooltip with a name of a random launch config. Not a selected one or running one, just a random one.

data.title: Where was the debug dropdown border color sourced from?
data.body:
#16494

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (c425cd159bd389844e9400be801675f54f2443c7, 2016-12-06T17:07:24.668Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-28-generic

|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.1.0|
|theme-glacier|Tyriar|0.0.10|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.7.1|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.0.0|
|Theme-Wombat|gerane|0.0.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-vscode|0.0.10|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.2.1|
|dark-plus-material|vangware|0.1.4|

---

Prepare yourself for this... I could not find the grey you used in the debug dropdown in other areas of the editor. We should use an existing color :smile: 

- Debug border: `#383838`
- Viewlet section background: `#373737`
- Editor group separator: `#444444` 
- Activity bar background: `#333333`
- Text input background: `#3c3c3c`

|dark-plus-material|vangware|0.1.4|

---

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/20945359/ccdf9306-bbbb-11e6-9b73-bdb7e282a110.png)

I would expect either the dropdown's left to be aligned with the left edge of the play button container or the dropdown's right to be aligned with the right edge of the down arrow container.

I understand why it's like this as the `select` box is only the down arrow part. Was styling attempted to make the select the size of both left and right containers and then overlaying the play button part via `position: absolute`? I think this may be possible in a reasonable way since we only need to support Chrome.

data.title: Unknown error in console while opening ts file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8 insiders dated 12/6
- OS Version: All

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any workspace with a ts file 
2. Toggle Developer Tools to keep the dev tools open
3. Open the ts file

You will see the below in the console:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16890566/20945468/4462cee8-bbbc-11e6-84ec-f01bf6f84735.png)
